CWAInformalCount.title: Clean Water Act Informal Action Count
CWAInformalCount.description: Indicates the number of informal enforcement actions/notices of violations (NOVs) taken against the facility within the last five years under the Clean Water Act.

CWAFormalActionCount.title: Clean Water Act Formal Action Count
CWAFormalActionCount.description: Indicates the number of enforcement actions taken against the facility within the last five years under the Clean Water Act.

CWAPenalties.title: Clean Water Act Penalties
CWAPenalties.description: The total dollar amount of assessed (or final) penalties taken against the facility within the last five years under the Clean Water Act.

CWACurrComplianceStatus.title: Clean Water Act Current Compliance Status

RCRAIDs.title: Resource Conservation and Recovery Act IDs
RCRAIDs.description: A unique 12-character ID assigned for each record/permit/site/facility within the RCRAInfo database.

RCRAPermitTypes.title: Resource Conservation and Recovery Act Permit Types
RCRAPermitTypes.description:
RCRA Facility Types include:
- TSDF = Treatment, Storage and Disposal facility
- LQG = Large Quantity Generator
- SQG = Small Quantity Generator
- CESQG = Conditionally-Exempt Small Quantity Generator
- Operating TSDF
- Transporters

RCRAInspectionCount.title: Resource Conservation and Recovery Act Inspection Count
RCRAInspectionCount.description: The number of inspections/compliance evaluations under the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act, occurring at the facility within the last five years

RCRAInformalCount.title: RCRA Informal Action Count
RCRAInformalCount.description: Indicates the number of informal enforcement actions/notices of violations (NOVs) taken against the facility within the last five years under the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act.

RCRAFormalActionCount.title: RCRA Formal Action Count
RCRAFormalActionCount.description: Indicates the number of enforcement actions taken against the facility within the last five years under the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act.

SDWAIDs.description: A unique 9-character ID assigned for each public water system within the Safe Drinking Water Information System (SDWIS).

SDWAInformalCount.description: Indicates the number of informal enforcement actions/notices of violations (NOVs) taken against the facility within the last five years under the Safe Drinking Water Act

SDWAFormalActionCount.description: Indicates the number of enforcement actions taken against the facility within the last five years under the Safe Drinking Water Act

TRIIDs.title: Toxics Release Inventory Program IDs
TRIIDs.description: A unique 15-character ID assigned for each facility within the Toxics Release Inventory (TRI) program. The format is ZZZZZNNNNNSSSSS, where ZZZZZ = ZIP code, NNNNN = the first 5 consonants of the name, and SSSSS = the first 5 non-blank non-special characters in the street address.

TRIReleasesTransfers.title: TRI Release Transfers
TRIReleasesTransfers.description: Total chemical releases, in pounds, as reported to the Toxics Release Inventory (TRI) by the facility for the most recent reporting year

TRIOffSiteTransfers.title: Toxics Release Inventory Offsite Transfer Count

TRIReporterInPast.title: Toxics Release Inventory Reporter In Past Flag

FecCaseIDs.description: All Case Numbers of Federal Enforcement Cases relating to the Facility from the ICIS System

GHGCO2Releases.title: Greenhouse Gas Reporting CO2 Releases
GHGCO2Releases.description: The sum of total release amounts of all linked Greenhouse Gas IDs reported as "metric tons of CO2 equivalents"

FacMapFlg.title: Facility Mapped Flag
FacMapFlg.description: Graphical indicator denoting whether geographical data required to map a facility are available.

CensusBlockGroup.title: Census Block Group
CensusBlockGroup.description: A geographic unit used by the United States Census Bureau, generally defined to contain between 600 and 3,000 people.

PctilePctpre1960Us.description: The national percentile of the census block group for the EJSCREEN Lead paint indicator.

PctileDpmUs.description: The national percentile of the census block group for the EJSCREEN diesel particulate matter indicator.

PctileCancerUs.description: The national percentile of the census block group for the EJSCREEN NATA air toxics cancer risk indicator.

PctileRespUs.description: The national percentile of the census block group for the EJSCREEN NATA respiratory hazard index indicator.

PctileTrafficScoreUs.description: The national percentile of the census block group for the EJSCREEN Traffic proximity and volume indicator.

PctileProximityNPDESUs.description: The national percentile of the census block group for the EJSCREEN proximity to major direct water dischargers indicator.

PctileProximityNplUs.description: The national percentile of the census block group for the EJSCREEN proximity to National Priorities List (NPL) sites indicator.

PctileProximityRmpUs.description: The national percentile of the census block group for the EJSCREEN proximity to Risk Management Plan (RMP) sites indicator.

PctileProximityTsdfUs.description: The national percentile of the census block group for the EJSCREEN proximity to Treatment Storage and Disposal Facilities (TSDFs) indicator.

PctileO3Us.description: The national percentile of the census block group for the EJSCREEN ozone indicator.

PctilePmUs.description: The national percentile of the census block group for the EJSCREEN particulate matter indicator.

MaxPctileUs.description: The maximum percentile from all individual EJSCREEN indicators.

CurrSvFlag.title: Current Significant Violation Flag
CurrSvFlag.description: Indicates if the facility has a current significant violation. 1 = Yes

ViolFlag.title: Violation Flag
ViolFlag.description: Indicates if the facility had a violation within the last 3 years. 1 = Yes

CurrVioFlag.title: Current Violation Flag
CurrVioFlag.description: Indicates if the facility has a current violation. 1 = Yes

Insp5yrFlag.title: Inspected Within Last Five Years Flag
Insp5yrFlag.description: Indicates if the facility has an inspection within the last 5 years. 1 = Yes

Ea5yrFlag.description: Indicates if the facility has a formal enforcement action within the last 5 years. 1 = Yes

Infea5yrFlag.description: Indicates if the facility has an informal enforcement action within the last 5 years. 1 = Yes.

Lower48.title: Contiguous United States Flag
Lower48.description: Flag showing Y/N whether location is within the contiguous (lower 48) United States.

Message.title: Message
Message.description: Field to record messages (typically performance-related) about packet processing

QueryID.title: Query Identifier
QueryID.description: Sequential number assigned to entire search result

PageNo.title: Page Number
PageNo.description: The number of pages of results returned

VersionNmbr.title: Version Number
VersionNmbr.description: The version of the permit when a modification or reissuance is applied to the permit. Version = 0 indicates the original permit issuance

PermFeatureId.title: Permit Feature ID
PermFeatureId.description: The unique identifier in ICIS-NPDES of a permitted feature or outfall

LimitSetId.title: Limit Set ID
LimitSetId.description: The unique identifier for a limit set, generated in ICIS-NPDES

LimitSetScheduleId.title: Limit Set Schedule ID
LimitSetScheduleId.description: The unique identifier of the Limit Set Schedule, generated in ICIS-NPDES

NmbrOfSubmission.title: Number of Submissions
NmbrOfSubmission.description: The number of months of discharges represented on each DMR for the limit set (e.g., monthly = 1, bi-monthly = 2, quarterly = 3, triannual = 4, semi-annual = 6, annual = 12). This data element will be blank for Unscheduled Limit Sets

LimitId.title: Limit ID
LimitId.description: The unique identifier for a limit parameter record

LimitBeginDate.title: Limit Begin Date
LimitBeginDate.description: The date on which a limit becomes in effect for a particular parameter in a limit set

LimitEndDate.title: Limit End Date
LimitEndDate.description: The date on which a limit stops being in effect for a particular parameter in a limit set

LimitValueId.title: Limit Value ID
LimitValueId.description: The unique identifier in ICIS-NPDES for the Limit Value

LimitValueTypeCode.title: Limit Value Code
LimitValueTypeCode.description: The code indicating the type of value the limit is given as (i.e., Q1, Q2, C1, C2, C3)

LimitValueTypeDesc.title: Limit Value Type
LimitValueTypeDesc.description: The description indicating the type of value the limit is given as (e.g., Concentration, Quantity)

LimitValueNmbr.title: Limit Value
LimitValueNmbr.description: The numerical limit for a given parameter

LimitUnitCode.title: Limit Unit Code
LimitUnitCode.description: The code representing the unit of measure applicable to quantity or concentration limits and measurements as entered by the user

LimitUnitDesc.title: Limit Unit Description
LimitUnitDesc.description: The short description of the unit of measure applicable to limit or DMR values

StdUnitCode.title: Standard Unit Code
StdUnitCode.description: The code representing the standard unit of measure applicable to quantity or concentration limits and measurements as entered by the user

StdUnitDesc.title: Standard Unit Description
StdUnitDesc.description: The short description of the standard unit of measure applicable to limit or DMR values

LimitValueStdUnits.title: Limit Value in Standard Units
LimitValueStdUnits.description: The limit value expressed in standard units, as calculated in ICIS-NPDES

StatisticalBaseCode.title: Statistical Base Code
StatisticalBaseCode.description: The code representing the unit of measure applicable to the limit and DMR values entered by the user (e.g., 30-day average, daily maximum)

StatisticalBaseTypeCode.title: Statistical Base Type Code
StatisticalBaseTypeCode.description: The code indicating whether the statistical base code is a minimum, average, or maximum for purposes of calculating compliance against the limit value

StatisticalBaseTypeDesc.title: Statistical Base Type
StatisticalBaseTypeDesc.description: A short description for indicating whether the statistical base code is a minimum, average, or maximum for purposes of calculating compliance against the limit value

LimitValueQualifierCode.title: Limit Value Qualifier
LimitValueQualifierCode.description: The unique code identifying the limit value operator (i.e., <, <=, >, >=, T, E, =). E indicates an estimated value. T indicates too numerous to count

StayValueNmbr.title: Stay Value Number
StayValueNmbr.description: The numeric limit value imposed during the period of the stay for the limit; if entered, during the stay period, ICIS-NPDES will use this limit value for calculating compliance rather than the actual limit value

DMREventId.title: DMR Event ID
DMREventId.description: The sequence ID identifying the DMR Event.

MonitoringPeriodEndDate.title: Monitoring Period End Date
MonitoringPeriodEndDate.description: The date that the monitoring period for the values covered by the DMR Form ends

DMRFormValueId.title: Measured Value ID
DMRFormValueId.description: The sequence ID identifying the DMR Form Value.

ValueTypeCode.title: Measured Value Type Code
ValueTypeCode.description: The indication of the limit value type (e.g., Quantity 1, Concentration 2)

ValueTypeDesc.title: Measured Value Type
ValueTypeDesc.description: The type of value the measured number is given as (e.g., Concentration, Quantity)

DMRValueId.title: Measured Value ID
DMRValueId.description: The unique identifier for the DMR value generated in ICIS-NPDES

DMRValueNmbr.title: Measured Value
DMRValueNmbr.description: The DMR value number reported on the DMR Form

DMRUnitCode.title: Measured Value Unit Code
DMRUnitCode.description: The code representing the unit of measure applicable to quantity or concentration limits and measurements as entered into ICIS-NPDES

DMRUnitDesc.title: Measured Value Unit
DMRUnitDesc.description: The short description of the unit of measure applicable to limit or DMR values

DMRValueStdUnits.title: Measured Value Standard Units
DMRValueStdUnits.description: The DMR value expressed in standard units, as calculated in ICIS-NPDES

DMRValueQualifierCode.title: DMR Value Qualifier Code
DMRValueQualifierCode.description: The unique code identifying the DMR value operator (i.e., <, <=, >, >=, T, E, =). E indicates an estimated value. T indicates too numerous to count

ValueReceivedDate.title: Date Received
ValueReceivedDate.description: The date the DMR value was received by the regulatory authority

DaysLate.title: Days Received Late
DaysLate.description: The number of days the DMR value is late, as generated in ICIS-NPDES

NODICode.title: No Discharge Code
NODICode.description: The unique code indicating why no DMR Value was submitted by the permittee for a Monitoring Period End Date

ExceedencePct.title: Exceedance Percentage
ExceedencePct.description: The percent by which the DMR value (or adjusted value) exceeded its limit (or stay) value, as generated in ICIS-NPDES

NPDESViolationId.title: NPDES Violation ID
NPDESViolationId.description: The unique identifier in ICIS-NPDES for the NPDES Violation

ViolationCode.title: Violation Code
ViolationCode.description: The code identifying which type of Violation has occurred (e.g., D80 = Required Monitoring DMR Value Non-Receipt, E90 = Effluent Violation, C20 = Schedule Event Achieved Late)

ViolationDesc.title: Violation
ViolationDesc.description: A description of which type of violation has occurred

RNCDetectionCode.title: RNC Violation Code
RNCDetectionCode.description:
The code indicating the reportable noncompliance (RNC) detected for a violation:
- A = Enforcement Order
- B = Manual 2A4 - Pass-Through
- C = Chronic Violation
- D = Manual Other
- E = Manual 2F - Permit Narrative
- F = Manual 2G - Violation of Concern
- G = Manual 2A1 - Effluent Violation
- H = Chronic Violation, Non-Monthly Average
- I = Manual 2A2 - Unauthorized Bypass
- J = Manual 2A3 - Unpermitted Discharge
- K = Non-receipt Violation, Non-Monthly Average
- N = Non-Receipt of DMR/Schedule Report
- P = Enforcement Order, Non-Monthly Average
- Q = Manual 2B - Pretreatment
- R = TRC Limitations Exceeded, Non-Monthly Average
- S = Schedule Violation
- T = TRC Limitations Exceeded
- U = Other Violation with TRC Non-Monthly Average
- V = Other Violation with TRC
- W = Manual 2E - Deficient Report
- X = Manual Other Violation with TRC
- Y = Manual TRC
- Z = Manual Chronic

RNCDetectionDesc.title: RNC Violation
RNCDetectionDesc.description: A description of the reportable noncompliance (RNC) detected

RNCDetectionDate.title: Detection Date
RNCDetectionDate.description: The date that the exceedance was detected

RNCResolutionCode.title: RNC Resolution Type Code
RNCResolutionCode.description: The code indicating the resolution of noncompliance (RNC) for a violation

RNCResolutionDesc.title: RNC Resolution Type
RNCResolutionDesc.description:
- 1 = Unresolved RNC
- 2 = Back into Compliance
- 3 = Due to Formal Enforcement Action Final Order with Compliance Schedule
- 4 = In Compliance with Formal Enforcement Action Final Order Requirement
- 5 = Resolved RP by NPDES Closure of Enforcement Action Final Order with Compliance Schedule
- 6 = Manual Resolution by Enforcement Action
- 7 = Manual RP - In Compliance with Formal Enforcement Action Order Requirement
- 8 = Manual Due to Formal Enforcement Action Formal Order
- 9 = Manual by Back into Compliance
- A = Manual Unresolved RNC
- B = Manual by EPA/State/Tribal Action

RNCResolutionDate.title: Resolution Date
RNCResolutionDate.description: The date RNC was marked to its current resolution status. It can be entered manually or automatically

ViolationSeverity.title: Violation Severity
ViolationSeverity.description:
- 0 = no violation.
- 1 = monitoring or reporting violation
- 2 = effluent violation, i.e., discharge in excess of permitted limit
- 3 = reportable noncompliance
- 5 = significant noncompliance

ParameterCode.title: Parameter Code
ParameterCode.description: The unique 5 digit numeric code identifying the parameter. If the code is less than 5 digits in the .CSV, append zeros to the beginning of the number (e.g., 100 is equivalent to 00100)

ParameterDesc.title: Parameter Description
ParameterDesc.description: The pollutant name and form (e.g., dissolved, suspended) associated with the parameter code

MonitoringLocationCode.title: Monitoring Location Code
MonitoringLocationCode.description: The code that the monitoring location at which the monitoring requirement (and effluent limit if limited) applies. One parameter may have several monitoring location codes pertaining to the same permitted feature

MonitoringLocationDesc.title: Monitoring Location Description
MonitoringLocationDesc.description: The name of the monitoring location at which the monitoring requirement (and effluent limit if limited) applies

StayTypeCode.title: Stay Type Code
StayTypeCode.description: The unique identifier of the type of stay applied to a limit (e.g., X, Y, Z), which indicates whether the limits do not appear on the DMR at all, are treated as monitor only, or have a stay value in effect during the period of the stay

StayTypeDesc.title: Stay Type Description
StayTypeDesc.description: The name of the type of stay applied to a limit, which indicates whether the limits do not appear on the DMR at all (X), are treated as monitor only (Y), or have a stay value in effect during the period of the stay (Z)

DischargeMonitoringReports.title: Effluent Discharge Monitoring Report
DischargeMonitoringReports.description: An array of Discharge Monitoring Report (DMR) data.

PermFeatureNmbr.title: Discharge Point
PermFeatureNmbr.description: A three-character code in ICIS-NPDES that identifies the point of discharge (e.g., outfall) for a facility. A NPDES permit may have multiple points of discharge. If the code is less than three characters in the .CSV, append zeros to the beginning of the number (e.g., 1 is equivalent to 001)

PermFeatureTypeCode.title: Permit Feature Type Code
PermFeatureTypeCode.description: The code indicating the type of permitted feature (e.g., EXO)

PermFeatureTypeDesc.title: Permit Feature Type
PermFeatureTypeDesc.description: The description indicating the type of permitted feature (e.g., External Outfall, Internal Outfall, Sum)

Message.title: Message
Message.description: Field to record messages (typically performance-related) about packet processing

EPASystem.title: EPA Data System
EPASystem.description:
The EPA data system in which permit and facility records are kept. EPA's Facility Registry System (FRS) links all program database records (such as permit IDs and IDs facilities use in reporting to EPA) together. The following list describes the individual data systems that are linked to from the detailed facility report: 

- AFS: Air Facility System for Clean Air Act stationary source programs.
- ICP: Integrated Compliance Information System for Clean Water Act programs monitoring National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System (NPDES) permits.
- RCR: Resource Conservation and Recovery Act Information System (RCRAInfo) for tracking the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act (RCRA) programs.
- NCDB: National Compliance Database System for monitoring national performance of the Toxic Substance Control Act (TSCA); the Emergency Planning and Right-to-Know Act, Section 313 (EPCRA); the Asbestos Hazard Emergency Response (AHERA); and the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act (FIFRA).
- TRI: Toxics Release Inventory for Emergency Planning and Community Right-to-Know Act, Section 313 submissions.
- NEI: National Emissions Inventory database contains information on stationary and mobile sources that emit criteria air pollutants and their precursors, as well as hazardous air pollutants (HAPs). The database includes estimates of annual emissions, by source, of air pollutants in each area of the country, on an annual basis.
- TSCA: Toxic Substances Control Act addressing the production, importation, use, and disposal of specific chemicals.

RegistryId.title: FRS Registry ID
RegistryId.description: 12-digit Facility Registry Service (FRS) identification number.  FRS uniquely identifies a facility by assigning an identification number (FRS ID), and uses this FRS ID to link together all EPA regulatory program database records

Statute.title: Regulatory Statute
Statute.description:
The name of the statute associated with each of the permits and identifiers linked to the facility: 
- CAA = the Clean Air Act
- CWA = the Clean Water Act
- RCRA = the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act
- EP313 = the Emergency Planning and Community Right-to-Know Act, Section 313 (also known as the Toxics Release Inventory Program)
- TSCA = the Toxic Substances Control Act
- SDWA = the Safe Drinking Water Act

CWPName.title: Facility Name
CWPName.description: Facility or permit holder name, as maintained in ICIS-NPDES.

CWPCity.title: City
CWPCity.description: City in which the facility is located.

CWPPermitStatusDesc.title: Permit Status Description
CWPPermitStatusDesc.description: The current stage/status in the NPDES permit life cycle.

CWPMajorMinorStatusFlag.title: Major/Minor Status Flag
CWPMajorMinorStatusFlag.description:
Facilities marked "M" for major refers to CWA major permittees.
- M = Major
- N = Minor

CWPPermitTypeDesc.title: Permit Type Description
CWPPermitTypeDesc.description:
NPDES facility permit classification:
- NPDES Individual Permit
- General Permit Covered Facility
- NPDES Master General Permit
- Associated Permit Record
- Individual Industrial User Permit
- Individual State Issued Permit
- State Issued Master General Permit
- Unpermitted Facility

CWPCurrentSNCStatus.description: The type of noncompliance when a major source is in significant violation or a minor source has a Category 1 violation.

StartDate.title: Start Date
StartDate.description: Starting date for the date range of interest. Formatted as mm/dd/yyyy

EndDate.title: End Date
EndDate.description: End date for the date range of interest. Formatted as mm/dd/yyyy

CWPName.description: Facility or permit holder name, as maintained in ICIS-NPDES.

CWPCity.title: City
CWPCity.description: City in which the facility is located.

CWPPermitStatusDesc.title: Permit Status Description
CWPPermitStatusDesc.description: The current stage/status in the NPDES permit life cycle.

CWPMajorMinorStatusFlag.title: Major/Minor Status Flag
CWPMajorMinorStatusFlag.description:
Facilities marked "M" for major refers to CWA major permittees.
- M = Major
- N = Minor

CWPPermitTypeDesc.title: Permit Type Description
CWPPermitTypeDesc.description:
NPDES facility permit classification:
- NPDES Individual Permit
- General Permit Covered Facility
- NPDES Master General Permit
- Associated Permit Record
- Individual Industrial User Permit
- Individual State Issued Permit
- State Issued Master General Permit
- Unpermitted Facility

CWPCurrentSNCStatus.description: The type of noncompliance when a major source is in significant violation or a minor source has a Category 1 violation.

ParameterCode.title: Parameter Code
ParameterCode.description: The unique 5 digit numeric code identifying the parameter. If the code is less than 5 digits in the .CSV, append zeros to the beginning of the number (e.g., 100 is equivalent to 00100)

ParameterDesc.title: Parameter Description
ParameterDesc.description: The pollutant name and form (e.g., dissolved, suspended) associated with the parameter code

MaxVioStatus.title: Most Severe Compliance Status
MaxVioStatus.description: The most severe compliance status for an outfall and parameter during the entire selected date range

CurrentVioStatus.title: Current Violation Status
CurrentVioStatus.description: The most severe compliance status for an outfall and parameter during the current monitoring period

PermFeatureNmbr.title: Discharge Point
PermFeatureNmbr.description: A three-character code in ICIS-NPDES that identifies the point of discharge (e.g., outfall) for a facility. A NPDES permit may have multiple points of discharge. If the code is less than three characters in the .CSV, append zeros to the beginning of the number (e.g., 1 is equivalent to 001)

PermFeatureTypeCode.title: Permit Feature Type Code
PermFeatureTypeCode.description: The code indicating the type of permitted feature (e.g., EXO)

PermFeatureTypeDesc.title: Permit Feature Type
PermFeatureTypeDesc.description: The description indicating the type of permitted feature (e.g., External Outfall, Internal Outfall, Sum)

type.title: Geometry
type.description: Indicator of the geometry represented in the GeoJSON Feature, for Echo will always be "Point".

coordinates.title: Coordinates Array
coordinates.description: Array of coordinate values in longitude, latitude format.

DataType.title: Data Type
DataType.description: Data type for EPA program database column.

DataLength.title: Data Length

Description.title: Description

FacFIPSCode.title: FIPS Code
FacFIPSCode.description: The 2-digit Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS) code to identify the county that a facility is located in.

FacLat.title: Latitude
FacLat.description: The latitude of the facility in decimal degrees expressed using the NAD83 horizontal datum. The coordinate comes from the FRS EPA Locational Reference Tables (LRT) file which represents the most accurate value for the facility based on the available spatial metadata.

FacLong.title: Longitude
FacLong.description: The longitude of the facility in decimal degrees expressed using the NAD83 horizontal datum. The coordinate comes from the FRS EPA Locational Reference Tables (LRT) file which represents the most accurate value for the facility based on the available spatial metadata.

FacUsMexBorderFlg.title: Near US-Mexico Border
FacUsMexBorderFlg.description: A Y/N flag indicating that the facility is within 100KM of the US-Mexico Border.

FacPercentMinority.title: Facility Percent Minority
FacPercentMinority.description: Percent Minority is the percentage of the population of the given area that is considered minority. Statistics are shown for the area within a 3-mile radius of each facility.

FacFederalAgencyCode.title: Facility Federal Agency Code
FacFederalAgencyCode.description: Indicates the federal agency, as classified in FRS. Federal agencies are installations that are owned and operated by the U.S. government. The five-character code consists of a letter followed by four numbers. There are four possible letters that can occupy the first character position: C = Civilian Federal Agency; D = Department of Defense; E = Department of Energy; X = Unknown. The second and third characters represent the agency code, while the fourth and fifth characters represent the bureau code.

ChesapeakeBayFlag.title: Chesapeake Bay Flag
ChesapeakeBayFlag.description: Displays "Y" if the facility is located within the Chesapeake Bay watershed.

RCRAIDs.title: Resource Conservation and Recovery Act IDs

TRIIDs.title: Toxics Release Inventory Program IDs
TRIIDs.description: A unique 15-character ID assigned for each facility within the Toxics Release Inventory (TRI) program. The format is ZZZZZNNNNNSSSSS, where ZZZZZ = ZIP code, NNNNN = the first 5 consonants of the name, and SSSSS = the first 5 non-blank non-special characters in the street address.

SDWAIDs.description: A unique 9-character ID assigned for each public water system within the Safe Drinking Water Information System (SDWIS).

FacTRIReporter.title: Facility TRI Reporter
FacTRIReporter.description: Indicates whether facility reported to the Toxics Release Inventory (TRI) for the most recent reporting year.

FacDerivedHuc.title: Watershed (HUC Code)
FacDerivedHuc.description: The 8-digit Hydrologic Unit Code (HUC) of the watershed in which the facility resides. A HUC number is assigned to every watershed in the nation and uniquely identifies the watershed.

FacMapFlg.description: Graphical indicator denoting whether geographical data required to map a facility are available.

EPASystem.title: EPA Data System
EPASystem.description:
The EPA data system in which permit and facility records are kept. EPA's Facility Registry System (FRS) links all program database records (such as permit IDs and IDs facilities use in reporting to EPA) together. The following list describes the individual data systems that are linked to from the detailed facility report: 

- AFS: Air Facility System for Clean Air Act stationary source programs.
- ICP: Integrated Compliance Information System for Clean Water Act programs monitoring National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System (NPDES) permits.
- RCR: Resource Conservation and Recovery Act Information System (RCRAInfo) for tracking the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act (RCRA) programs.
- NCDB: National Compliance Database System for monitoring national performance of the Toxic Substance Control Act (TSCA); the Emergency Planning and Right-to-Know Act, Section 313 (EPCRA); the Asbestos Hazard Emergency Response (AHERA); and the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act (FIFRA).
- TRI: Toxics Release Inventory for Emergency Planning and Community Right-to-Know Act, Section 313 submissions.
- NEI: National Emissions Inventory database contains information on stationary and mobile sources that emit criteria air pollutants and their precursors, as well as hazardous air pollutants (HAPs). The database includes estimates of annual emissions, by source, of air pollutants in each area of the country, on an annual basis.
- TSCA: Toxic Substances Control Act addressing the production, importation, use, and disposal of specific chemicals.

RegistryID.title: FRS ID
RegistryID.description: An internal 12-digit Facility Registry Service (FRS) tracking number used to tie all facility data together in EPA regulatory program databases.

Statute.title: Regulatory Statute
Statute.description:
The name of the statute associated with each of the permits and identifiers linked to the facility: 
- CAA = the Clean Air Act
- CWA = the Clean Water Act
- RCRA = the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act
- EP313 = the Emergency Planning and Community Right-to-Know Act, Section 313 (also known as the Toxics Release Inventory Program)
- TSCA = the Toxic Substances Control Act
- SDWA = the Safe Drinking Water Act

QueryID.title: Query Identifier
QueryID.description: Sequential number assigned to entire search result

PageNo.title: Page Number
PageNo.description: The number of pages of results returned

Message.title: Message
Message.description: Field to record messages (typically performance-related) about packet processing

Version.title: Version
Version.description: Version of the SDWA system service

IndianCountryRows.title: Indian Country Row Count
IndianCountryRows.description: Number of facilities with tribal_flag populated

SVRows.title: Significant Violation Result Count
SVRows.description: Number of facilities with curr_sv_flag populated (CWP_STATUS = "Significant Violation")

CVRows.description: Summary count of the number of CWA facilities or SDWA public drinking water systems with current violations.

V3Rows.description: Number of facilities having one or more quarters in non-compliance (QNC) in the last three years

FEARows.description: Summary count of the number of facilities with a formal enforcement action in the past five years

InfFEARows.description: Number of facilities with infea_5yr_flag populated (INFORMAL_ENF_ACT_COUNT > 0)

INSPRows.description: Number of facilities with insp_5yr_flag populated (CWP_DATE_LAST_INSPECTION)

QueryID.title: Query Identifier

PageNo.title: Page Number
PageNo.description: The number of pages of results returned

sdw3_SDWSearchResults.description: Safe Drinking Water Search Results Object

PWSId.title: Public Water System Identifier
PWSId.description: Unique identifying code for a public water system, consisting of a two-letter state or region code, followed by seven digits

SystemName.title: System Name
SystemName.description: Name of the system regulated under the Safe Drinking Water Act (SDWA)

SystemType.title: System Type
SystemType.description:
Type of public water system:
- CWS   = Community water system
- NCWS  = Non-community water system
- NTCWS = Non-transient non-community water system
- TNCWS = Transient non-community water system

SourceWaterType.title: Source Water Type
SourceWaterType.description:
Source Water Type:
- SW = Surface water
- GW = Ground water
- GU = Ground water under direct influence of (UDI) surface water
- SWP = Purchased Surface water
- GWP = Purchased Ground water
- GUP = Purchased Ground water UDI surface water

PopulationServed.title: Population Served
PopulationServed.description: Estimated average daily population served by a system

QNC.title: Quarters in Noncompliance
QNC.description: Number of quarters the system was in violation over the past three years (12 most recent quarters)

IEA.description: Number of informal enforcement responses during the past 5 years (20 most recent quarters) as of the last quarterly refresh.  Informal enforcement actions do not specify actions and deadlines for returning to compliance

FEA.description: Number of formal enforcement responses during the past 5 years (20 most recent quarters) as of the last quarterly refresh.  Formal enforcement actions compel a PWS to take specific actions by specific dates to return to compliance

ACT.description:
Activity status code:
- A = Active
- I = Inactive

VioPointsAccrued.description: Sum of all violation points for violations reported during the past five years (20 most recent quarters), as of the last quarterly refresh

VioPointsFEANotCorrected.description: Sum of violation points accrued during past five years (20 most recent quarters) that are under formal enforcement but not yet returned to compliance, as of the last quarterly refresh

VioPointsRTCwFEA.description: Sum of violation points during past 5 years (20 most recent quarters) that received formal enforcement and returned to compliance, as of the last quarterly refresh

VioPointsRTCwoFEA.description: Sum of violation points during past 5 years (20 most recent quarters) that did not receive formal enforcement but did return to compliance, as of the last quarterly refresh

VioPointsRemaining.description: Sum of violation points that were not returned to compliance as of the last quarterly refresh.  Includes points that have received formal enforcement but have not returned to compliance

REG.description: EPA Region number where the system is located. Values range from 01 to 10.

Owner.title: Owner
Owner.description:
Owner/Operator:
- P = Private
- F = Federal Government
- S = State Government
- L = Local Government

ICO.title: Icon
ICO.description: Indicates whether the system is located in Indian Country

FIPS.description: Five-character Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS) value: 2-character state || 3-character county

MRFlag.description: Indicates whether system has monitoring and reporting violations

HealthFlag.title: Health Flag
HealthFlag.description: Indicates whether system has violations of health-based drinking water standards

OtherFlag.title: Other Flag
OtherFlag.description: Indicates whether system has other violations, such as failing to issue annual consumer confidence reports or maintain required records

PNFlag.title: Public Notice Violation Flag
PNFlag.description: Indicates whether system has Public Notice Violations (failure to immediately alert consumers of serious problem with drinking water)

SystemTypeDesc.title: System Type Description
SystemTypeDesc.description: The type of public water system (PWS) and description of corresponding SystemType code. A public water system is a system for the provision to the public of piped water for human consumption, which has at least 15 service connections or regularly serves a

ActivityDesc.title: Activity Description
ActivityDesc.description: Description of activity status code (ACT), e.g., active, inactive.

SeriousViolator.title: Serious Violator
SeriousViolator.description: Indicates whether system is a Serious Violator (has unresolved serious, multiple, and/or continuing violations that is designated as a priority candidate for formal enforcement)

SDW3yrComplianceQtrsStatus.description: Quarterly compliance status for the most recent 12 quarters. Each letter indicates the compliance status for the corresponding quarter

SDWContaminantsInViol3Yr.description: The contaminant name and code in violation of a SDWA regulation in the past three years
